definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: We could smell the dinner cooking in the next room.
sentences.chinese: 我們可聞得到隔壁房間燒菜的味道。

sentences.english: Don't overheat the oil when cooking.
sentences.chinese: 燒菜時不要把油燒得太熱。

sentences.english: The house had a large kitchen to cook in.
sentences.chinese: 這房子有個燒菜做飯的大廚房。

sentences.english: In the kitchen we cook our meals.
sentences.chinese: 我們在廚房裏燒菜做飯。

sentences.english: We use vegetable oil for cooking.
A stew without an onion is like a dance without a tambourine.
sentences.chinese: 燒菜沒有洋蔥就像跳舞沒有手鼓。

sentences.english: We use those gas cylinders at home.
sentences.chinese: 咱們家是用桶裝的煤氣來煮飯燒菜的。

sentences.english: If you know how to cook, good for you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你知道怎麼燒菜，那最好。

sentences.english: The fruit of this plant, used in cookery, Salad, and as stuffing for green olives.
sentences.chinese: 甜椒的果實其果，用來燒菜，做色拉或綠橄欖的佐料。

definition: to get food at a canteen
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
